newsitem.title: CHINA: China seeks regulation of insurance sector.
newsitem.headline: China seeks regulation of insurance sector.

text.p: China wants to step up supervision of insurance intermediaries to help standardise the sector, the Business Weekly said on Sunday.

China's insurance industry should focus on developing its already 200,000-strong band of insurance agents, the newspaper said, adding that the broker system should first be limited to developed regions such as Shanghai and Guangdong.
China would further open the insurance sector to foreign insurers, the newspaper said without giving further details.

American International Group of the United States and Japan's Tokio Marine and Fire Insurance are the only foreign insurers allowed to issue insurance policies in China though numerous insurance companies have set up representative offices.
